or even kinky details

of your sexual fantasies
can open you up to a world
of self-discovery

and awareness which can
help you understand yourself

and those around you much
better Dr. Justin Lehmiller

remarks Our fantasies
appear to reflect who we are
and seem to be designed

to meet our unique psychological
needs So let's dive in

and explore what our sexual

If you like it rough Do you like being
dominated in the bedroom?
How about BDSM?
BDSM is rooted in power exchange dynamics
between a couple Usually,
one person plays the submissive role

and the other plays the
dominant role And it's a pretty

popular type of fantasy One
study shows that over 74%
of respondents chose BDSM

as their favorite fetish
So there's that A desire

to always play the submissive
one in the bedroom indicates a

desire to lose control
Possibly as an escape
and a way of relieving stress
or anxiety According

to surveys in the book
Tell Me What You Want

by social psychologist Dr.
Justin Lehmiller those who prefer

to be dominated in the bedroom
often have anxiety around sex

and would rather someone else
take the lead to take some

of the pressure off them
Submission in the bedroom can be an

indication of needing to
feel intensely desired

or adored during sex
which is often associated

with an anxious attachment
style But for many,

losing control in the
bedroom can be freeing

and even work as a stress
reliever while reducing anxiety
So, Fifty Shades freed anyone?
On the other hand, those who prefer
to dominate may be craving

or lacking power in other
areas of their lives
and may be trying to compensate
for it in the bedroom Either way, those
who enjoy dominating in the bedroom tend
to possess stronger personalities Roleplay
or Cosplay I think we've all daydreamed

of being a character in
our favorite movie TV show

or even manga I mean,
how many people dress up
as Sailor Moon or Naruto for Halloween?
The excitement of roleplay

or cosplay can definitely
translate to the bedroom

and we don't blame you If
you're a fan of cosplay

or roleplay in the bedroom
then this might indicate
that you're seeking a form of escape

or distraction your regular
day-to-day life According

to clinical psychologist Dr.
Joshua Klapao Roleplay is

simply an opportunity to escape
our own reality By labeling

it in a formal way we are
giving permission to act, speak,
feel and think in a way

that may be dramatically
different from our true selves

There are various reasons
why a person might choose

to escape their reality by
engaging in roleplay such

as needing a break from
extreme stress or anxiety

or even an escape boredom As
long as it doesn't interfere

with important aspects
of life using roleplay
as an escape mechanism can be healthy
and a great way

to spice things up in the bedroom
Just remember that respect

and consent are absolutely
necessary when engaging in any

type of sexual activity
So never feel obligated

to do something you
aren't comfortable with

Sweetest Taboo Going back to
Dr. Lehmeler's study Those

who identify as extroverted
are more inclined

to fantasize about adventurous
sexual encounters such

as group sex and swinging It
also indicates a strong need

for attention When people
dream of a threesome

with their partner and one
other person it could be

because they want all of the
attention on them However,
the study found that those who identified
as introverts reported

to prefer kinkier sex And
surprisingly they were more open

to trying taboos in the
bedroom in comparison

to extroverts Dr. Lehmeler
explains the reasons
behind this stating

that introverts have a harder
time establishing the types

of sexual relationships they
want which can increase their
propensity for developing taboo

and uncommon sexual interests
It just goes to show
how different introverts
and extroverts truly are Foot fetish Okay,

so a foot fetish may seem
super taboo and deviant

but it's actually a very common
fetish According to research
by Lehmeler 1 in 14 people
or 14% report having a foot fetish
or a sexual fantasy related to feet But

what does fantasizing
about feet say about you?

Similar to BDSM some people
may enjoy a foot fetish when

they're either in a
submissive or dominant role

because it triggers arousal
For example someone might enjoy

someone else playing with
their feet in a submissive

position because it gives
them a sense of control

and power which is something
they might crave in their life

outside the bedroom On
the other hand someone

who prefers pleasuring
someone's feet in a submissive
position might enjoy the feeling

of being controlled which
can stem from early childhood

experiences and may
even be a way of coping

with trauma However fantasizing
about feet occasionally

doesn't necessarily mean you
have a full blown foot fetish

It just means you've been
turned on by the idea
of feet at least once Romance

and Passion Do you fantasize
about having a steamy
storybook romance?
If this is the case then according

- To Dr. Lehmiller you
might be the more anxious

and even the needy type He
says those who are more likely

to have romantic and passionate
imagery in their fantasies

could be trying to calm a
sense of insecurity This type
of fetish could also be rooted in a fear

of abandonment which could
stem from a series of broken
or disappointing relationships

that a person has
experienced in real life So

what do you think your
